page.title: 14RUSKINGTON PAST AND PRESENT1
page.content: In previous times, opposite to where the Co-operative shop now stands, a garage and hardware shop was situated, owned by G.J.S. Jackson. An interesting feature of the layout was that the petrol pump was positioned very close to the entrance to the premises. Customers do not appear to have been put off by having to squeeze past it in order to do business. Pinfold Antiques has replaced what used to be Peatman's grocery shop. The Peatman family also owned the village bakery in the centre of the village(now Wise Buys self-service shop) and were noted for their own baked bread. The shop always opened for a short while on Good Friday each year to sell fresh warm hot cross buns, traditional Easter fare. continued-
